node.title: Lukashenko Offers to Host Russia's Nuclear Weapons, Recognizes Crimea as Part of Russia
node.description: "I would offer Putin to return nuclear weapons to Belarus," said Belarusian President Alexander Lukashenko amid increasing tensions between Russia and NATO.

node.title: New Mexico is Seventh State Using Military to Treat COVID Patients Amid Staff Shortages
node.description: A 20-member medical team from the U.S. Navy is set to arrive Sunday to assist the San Juan Regional Medical Center.

node.title: Wife of Drug Kingpin El Chapo Sentenced to 3 Years Behind Bars for Drug Trafficking
node.description: The 32-year-old woman had been named as a co-conspirator in the Sinaloa Cartel and also faces a violation of the Foreign Narcotics Kingpin Designation Act.

node.title: National Guardsmen Without COVID Vaccine to Have Pay Withheld, Barred from Federal Drills
node.description: Guard members who decline the vaccine are banned from training required to maintain their status, losing their pay, retirement funds and other federal benefits.

node.title: Oklahoma Board Rejects Clemency for Death Row Inmate Who Attorneys Argue Is Mentally Ill
node.description: The Oklahoma Pardon and Parole Board rejected a clemency request for Donald Grant in a 4-1 vote despite his lawyers arguing he suffered from brain damage.

node.title: Woman's 'Obscene' Santa Display Goes Viral: 'The HOA Lady Just Had a Stroke'
node.description: "My husband forgot to zip-tie Santa's hand to WAVE. And now it's obscene," the video's text overlay said.

node.title: Kentucky Considering Corporal Punishment Ban for Some Students, Including Disabled
node.description: While most Kentucky schools no longer allow the use of physical force, there are still four districts that do permit it and 11 districts with no clear policy.

node.title: Man Accused of Dismembering Woman He Met at McDonalds After Cops Found Leg, Body
node.description: "We believe it's extremely important that we let the Tampa community know that the person responsible for this heinous crime is off the streets tonight," cops said.

node.title: PM disappointed government senator reportedly growled at Jacqui Lambie
node.description: Scott Morrison says he was "very, very disappointed" by reports a government senator growled while Jacqui Lambie spoke during Question Time in parliament yesterday.

node.title: 'Auckland is being punished' as government pulls wage subsidy - Hospitality NZ
node.description: Struggling hospitality businesses in Auckland say the government turning off their financial support will lead to "dreadful" summer. Audio

node.title: National's new leader discusses abortion and gay conversion therapy
node.description: Christopher Luxon told Checkpoint he is in favour of banning gay conversion therapy but was steadfast in his views on abortion. Audio

node.title: House price growth edges down for first time in more than a year
node.description: The annual pace of rising house prices has started to decline for the first time since August last year, slipping to 28.4 percent Audio

node.title: Auckland DHB vaccination rates sets 'new national benchmark' - epidemiologist
node.description: In the Auckland District Health Board area, 96.2 percent of eligible people have had at least one dose of the Covid-19 vaccine.

node.title: Hipkins: 'Inevitable' Omicron variant will show up in MIQ
node.description: The Omicron Covid-19 variant will inevitably turn up in MIQ but it is too soon to predict whether the country will revisit the plan to lift border restrictions from January, the Covid-19 Response…

node.title: Shortage of oximeters worries iwi healthcare provider
node.description: The boss of an iwi healthcare provider in Taranaki is worried a shortage of oximeters will hamper its ability to help whānau isolating at home with Covid-19.

node.title: 'Incomprehensible': Police investigate dangerous driving in Upper Hutt
node.description: Police are looking for three drivers seen tailgating each other around Upper Hutt, with cars mounting footpaths and later colliding with two other vehicles.

node.title: FDA advisers endorse Merck's COVID antiviral drug in narrow vote
node.description: The vote paves the way for the agency to authorize molnupiravir for emergency use in American adults.

node.title: Philip B. Heymann, 89, Dies; Prosecuted Watergate and Abscam
node.description: He served four presidents over six decades, mostly in the Justice Department and often as a key part of major investigations.

node.title: Here’s what to know about Oxford High School.
node.description: Located in Oxford, a small community in northern Oakland County, it is the only high school in the Oxford Community Schools district.

node.title: 'Dude Be Careful': TikToker Films Viral Videos of Alleged Scientology Meetings
node.description: "Welcome to Sunday service! All you have to do is follow the commands," said a Scientology official in the video.

node.title: Kyle Rittenhouse Is Destroying Rifle Used in Kenosha Shooting

node.title: Victoria records 1,179 COVID-19 cases and six deaths
node.description: The new cases were detected from 74,252 test results processed on Tuesday, and take the state's number of active infections to 11,959.

node.title: Reserve Bank still consulting on the future of cash
node.description: The central bank has been looking at the issue for the past few months, raising a range of options for future payments systems while preserving physical notes and coins even though usage is declining.

node.title: Televangelist Marcus Lamb Who Called Vaccine Mandate 'Sin' Against God Dies Of COVID
node.description: Marcus Lamb, founder of Daystar Television Network, said he took ivermectin in an effort to prevent COVID-19

node.title: More COVID-19 exposure sites identified in SA's south-east
node.description: Six new exposure sites are listed in Robe, despite the state recording no new cases of COVID-19 yesterday.

node.title: Uzo Aduba Adjusts Her Mood With Playlists and ‘The Real Housewives’
node.description: The actress talks about sports, her latest film and return to the stage, and why a clean, white pair of Converse All Stars is the shoe for almost any occasion.

node.title: Josephine Baker Becomes First Black Woman Interred in France’s Tomb of Heroes
node.description: President Macron hails the American-born dancer and French resistance fighter as a symbol of unity in a time of sharp division.

node.title: Authorities Looking for Those Who Illegally Cut Down Ancient Trees at New Mexico Monument
node.description: The alligator juniper trees, known for their characteristic furrowed bark that resembles alligator skin, were likely hundreds of years old, officials said.

node.title: U.S. Economic Recovery Remains Strong But Omicron Variant Could Complicate It: Officials
node.description: "The recent rise in COVID-19 cases and the emergence of the Omicron variant pose downside risks to employment and economic activity," Jerome Powell said.

node.title: Man Who Caused Chaos at Atlanta Airport When Gun Went off in Bag Turns Himself in: Police
node.description: Kenny Wells turned himself in 10 days after his gun went off at Atlanta International Airport's security checkpoint.
